name: HYDERABADI ZAIQA
address: 366 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: Love this neighborhood spot. Used to get the malai kofta but they seemed to have changed the recipe, but the goat biryani, pretty much any biryani is the way to go here.

Maybe the food is really authentic for native Hyderabadis.   But it didn't knock my socks off.  The gobi cauliflower was too saucy, bryinani too dry, lamb curry decent but all portions way too tiny--for both main dishes and sides.  There were steady stream of customers, but then again this is pretty much hells kitchen not far from theatre district and time square...

The venue is, even by NYC street food standard, a dump.  What you see in that picture is what you get.  A basement room with 3 tables.   I would've not come if not for my friend's insisting and infatuation.

Great Indian food option. Tasty flavors, more on the mild side. Just a smaller on the portion for the price (you get take out in the 8‚Äù round containers vs 10‚Äù). Still would recommend since there aren‚Äôt as many good options this part of the city.
Chicken 65 Biryani was insane and the Butter chicken was also very good.

Grubhubbed the order. Do not believe anyone who says this is ‚Äúauthentic‚Äù. Indian food stops being authentic when they start adding sugar to sauces in order to placate some imagined palates. The Malabar shrimp should be under desserts from the amount of sugar that was added to it. The sauce was sweet and otherwise tasteless. Frozen shrimp were thrown into a ready made sauce, unmarinaded, so zero taste to them. The chicken dum biryani was bland, just spiritless. Very disappointing overall. Don‚Äôt bother.
Best biryani I‚Äôve ever had in my life. Life changing. Please go. I will fly back to NYC just for the Zaiqa.
Very flavorful amazing food
The best Indian food I have had in the city

The food is simply unmatched here - when I crave Indian food this is the only place I want to go!!! Please try the Chicken 65!!

The service here is great and the only complaint I have is I wish the place was bigger/there was more seating! But even if there‚Äôs no seating when you go, it‚Äôs well worth the wait.
Very tasty, authentic and juicy. Great value. Recommend!
This place is sooo good. I'm reluctant to write a great review bc I want to keep this place a secret. But alas, we must! This place is top shelf! #trustme
SO GOOD!
Quality has gone down since opening. Used to be my favorite biryani and chicken 65 in the city.
Good avakai biryani, okayish paneer biryani and great vibes.
After all the hype, I was disappointed - vegetarian options atleast were bland. Still on the hunt for good hyderabadi biriyani in new york.
Excellent food, good service, good value for money.
WOW!
I‚Äôd give this place one dillion stars if I could <3

It‚Äôs ridiculous how flavorful this food was.  We understand why it was highly rated now. Only drawback is how tight it is and how uncomfortable the metal stools are.  Regardless, some of the best food in NYC can be found at hole in the wall places like this. We will be back.
Sunny was very cordial and had a smiling face. Overall for Indians and specially for Hyderabadis  this place takes you back home. A hidden gem!

Wow what a fantastic place. We are from a small town in Texas there is nothing like this for miles around. Service was great but the food was even better. If we lived here we would be here every week. We had the Samosas, Chicken and Vegetable Biryani.
the khorma is amazing

Today I visit HYd Zaiqa at New York,I had goat briyani and fish curry.
The food was amazing
Highly Recommended‚Ä¶one of the best biryani in New York City ..goat biryani & special Lollipop was amazing
This is a small cafe, with barstools aoong one wall, but you dont go there for atmosphere, you go for the food. The goat biryani is excellent. Enjoy some great food!

Let‚Äôs be clear, that goat korma was amazing! The garlic naan was perfect, pillowey top with a slight crunch on the botttom, light and moist. The samosas were on the better side of good, and the butter chicken (I‚Äôm lame, I know) was good but not great (shout out to Taj Grill in Buffalo for the best!). There‚Äôs only seating for a handful and so we shared a table with another pair, but that added to the charm actually. The wait staff were working their butts off on endless takeout orders but we‚Äôre kind and attentive if we needed anything, and it‚Äôs good to see such a small place being so busy. Very reasonable prices too. Hopefully they‚Äôll be here still on our next trip.
Gorgeous flatware and cutlery!
DELICIOUS. Like the Indian food I actually grew up with. Really nice guys too! Will definitely be our regular spot for Indian food in the neighborhood going forward

Service was efficient and the Mutton Fry Biriyani was decent. The Biriyani would have benefited being served with a boiled egg, fresh cilantro and raw onions to enhance the texture and flavour. Portion sizes were large - can easily share one biriyani between two. Apple and Google Pay was not accepted which is disappointing. Prices are reasonable considering portion sizes.

I recently visited this restaurant and was blown away by the authentic flavors and welcoming atmosphere. The moment you step inside, the aroma of fresh spices makes you hungry instantly.

We tried the butter chicken, goat bhuna, and garlic naan with chicken briyani each dish was perfectly cooked with rich, balanced spices. The portions were generous, and everything tasted freshly prepared. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed without ever feeling rushed.

Totally beyond my expectations. This restaurant creates a relaxed setting. Employees know how to make guests happy. You can tell from how good the food is and how well they treat you. This place ensures quality experiences.
Awesome food. Experienced the real India. Hyderabadi cuisine.
Hands down best Indian I‚Äôve had in my life, let alone in nyc. 100% reccomend.
Best butter chicken I ever had! Service was excellent!
We got goat biryani and chicken kadai. Food was delicious üòã space is very cramped but the great food makes up for the lack of space.

The biryani was delicious! I ordered the dum biryani, and the portion was perfect for one person. The place is quite small and a bit cramped, and there‚Äôs no wash basin available, so you‚Äôll need to use wet wipes. Despite that, the food and service were really good overall.

Delicious, authentic desi food in the heart of Manhattan! Great service, many vegetarian and non vegetarian options, good portions, and everything is reasonably priced as well. Run, don‚Äôt walk, to Hyderabadi Zaiqa ü§§
I just had the best biryani in New York  honestly, it might even be better than any I‚Äôve had back in India!‚Äù
Good Biryani, but not authentic. Biryani has no onions, no salad came with Biryani.
Worst food in New York
Do try briyani nice loved it
The briyani was too good üëç
Perfect Hyderabad ambience in NYC.
Everything we tasted was delicious and the service was impressively quick
Goat biryani was super good!
One of the best biryani in the nyc
Some of the best Indian food I‚Äôve had
Delish
Exquisite !
Go here for really authentic Hyderabadi Biryani. The seating area is very small though . I found rest of the food average.

One of the best spots for Indian food in the city. Note that this place is small and popular so if you want seating, be aware that there could be a wait. Not the best place for a large group either. Food wise, we loved everything. The naan is great and you can‚Äôt go wrong with their biryanis. I loved the butter chicken!

Ambiance (4/5): The restaurant is located down a few stairs, no outdoor dining. The inside is super cozy with 3 tables that can seat 4-6, and then a high-top seating. Bare bones establishment.
Service (4/5): Since there was not many patrons inside, I was able to place my order immediately. I did have to ask for a refill of water.
Dum Ka Murgh $15.49 (5/5): The portion felt small but it was more than enough (leftovers too). It came with a side of rice. The curry is thick and packed with flavor. The chicken thigh pieces were cooked to complete tenderness. I loved every bite of it!!
I can‚Äôt recommend enough and will be returning to try other dishes.

Comida deliciosa. Precios razonables y las porciones son m√°s grandes de lo que parecen. Pedimos 3 platillos con side de arroz y naan y no nos lo pudimos acabar entre dos. Puedes comer por $20 d√≥lares una buena cantidad de comida!

Hole in the wall, tiny joint with insanely good Indian food (this is coming from an Indian). We got the dum goat biryani and chicken chettinand. probably the best chicken chettinand I have ever had. The balance of the spices is PERFECTION. Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

I love it here!! I live nearby and go a couple times a month!! One of my favorites spots across all 5 boroughs!! Excellent for both vegetarians and meat eaters!! I recommend the Chat Samosa, Gobi 65, Garlic Naan, Dal makhani, Aloo Gobi, Paneer Tika masala, HZ curry, and mango lassi

Excellent Indian food with tons of flavor
We tried the Gobi Manchurian ,Butter Chicken and the goat biryani
Highly recommend the butter chicken and the goat biryani
I had one of the best goat biryani at this place
The place is not fancy by the food is mouth watering and taste and flavor craves more of it
Definitely deserve a visit

Rating: 1/5 ‚Äì Extremely Disappointed

I had an utterly disappointing experience with Hyderabad Zaika. The Chicken Tangri Kabab I received was pathetic, stale, and unfit for consumption ‚Äî it felt like a leftover carelessly dispatched. The naan was cold and dry, completely lacking freshness. To make things worse, the mango lassi was sour and clearly stale, which raises serious concerns about food safety.

This wasn‚Äôt a one-off. During a previous order, I got what they called ‚ÄúChicken 65 Biryani‚Äù, which was nothing more than some generic chilli chicken tossed with rice ‚Äî a far cry from an authentic or even decent biryani.

Very poor show, Hyderabad Zaika. I‚Äôve revised my rating to 1 star. Food quality, hygiene, and authenticity need urgent attention.

Halal Indian restaurant in midtown. Small location with not a lot of seating during peak hours, usually there are people waiting.  I tried the Hyderabadi boneless chicken biryani. It was very good, lots of flavor & spice.

Outstanding hole in the wall Indian spot. Known for their biryani so I‚Äôll be back, but the Tikka Masala was superb and was kind of ‚ÄúAmerican medium‚Äù on spice, but still incredibly flavorful. Some of the best garlic naan I‚Äôve ever had. Crisped just right on the edges, pillowy in the center. Solid. Very casual and on the small side. Seems to do a lot of takeout, and it didn‚Äôt look like they had a bathroom. I don‚Äôt know if it makes sense to dine in with more than four people so plan accordingly.
Phenomenal food. Exceptional biryani. It‚Äôs a little joint, which is a hidden gem. Highly recommended!
A literally fantastic hole in the wall. Had heard some great things and I only had the appetite to master one dish. The Lamb biryani was absolutely fantastic

I liked this place but it didn‚Äôt live up to its hype. We ordered chicken 65, special boneless biryani and double ka meetha. I loved the dessert, the other two were pretty average. There are definitely better Indian places in the city than this one, but it was also my first time. Might have to visit this place again to make a permanent opinion.
Tried the Chicken Dum Biryani here and it was flavorful and comforting. The rice was fragrant, chicken tender, and the spice level just right. A satisfying Hyderabadi touch in the heart of New York!

Super reasonably priced Indian food, kind of a hole in the wall and it is super cramped because of how popular it is.

Butter chicken and lamb korma were pretty good, we would recommend getting those. The flavor profile is definitely on the creamier side though!

Samosas were mediocre and we wouldn‚Äôt get that again.

Garlic naans were good! Service was fast and there‚Äôs always a ton of people waiting outside for pickup/delivery. Weekday dinners are not too bad though.

Low-key, but delicious! We had the lamb biryani (the best), chicken korma (very very good), garlic naan (fantastic) and samosas (okay...I would skip next time). Mango lassi was great and service was friendly and fast.  All really affordable too. I get the hype.

Biryani‚Äôs my favorite. Everything else is good, I like how they have menus that other Indian restaurants in America don‚Äôt typically have. I avoid dining in whenever possible, the place is cramped and the line is not worth the wait.

HIGHLY recommend this place!!! We went for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon and the service was insanely quick. The restaurant itself has no more than a few tables but the food is amazing. Definitely recommend the Chicken 65 biriyani, so flavorful and the chicken is so tender. Also recommend the Lasuni Gobi, very very delicious. One of the best Indian places I‚Äôve been to in the city!!

Fantastic Indian food in such a typical NYC small restaurant with only a few tables and a bar to eat at.

My partner and I stopped in for an early dinner and were seated at the bar.  For a starter we ordered the Samosa, which were very good.

I ordered the Paneer Makhani served with rice.  Amazing flavors and the paneer tasted so fresh.  My partner ordered the Paneer Tikki Masala and just loved the flavors.

Service is amazing and so helpful.

Loved the feel of the place.

It is a small shop with limited seating. Don‚Äôt expect any vibe, but the food more than makes up for it! It is highly recommended. We ordered Hyderabadi Vegetable Gongura Dum biryani which came with raita. It was delicious! I single-handedly finished the whole portion for two. It was not oily, filled with veggies and each bite was a taste bomb. We also ordered Goat Bhuna which came with a side of rice, and a chilli naan. Both were super tasty too. The price is also reasonable.
Anyone who sees this review and is in the area must try their food.

It was an incredible experience, worthy of being in the Michelin guide, small space but everything delicious.

Excellent vegetarian option

Hyderabadi Zaiqa is a cozy little place in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen that has *the* best Hyderabad Dum Biryani I have ever had in the US. Anywhere. It tastes so authentic and is equally fragrant, flavorful and subtle with tender pieces of Mutton. We also had the Chicken Vepudu (a Telugu specialty) and that was absolutely delicious. We tried their version of Gobi 65, whose lip smacking sauce tasted like a fresh, homemade, tomato chutney. We rounded the meal off with Methi Paneer and left smiling and satisfied. I highly recommend this spot to anyone in search of authentic, Hyderabadi cuisine in a friendly, no frills setting. 10/10! I wish we had leftovers üò≠

Fun, casual atmosphere. The music is a bit loud, but not very. I bring headphones when eating alone but I also love the music.

The chettinad curry with lamb was great. It's coconut based and pretty thick and fattening, but very good. I got it with butter free roti and it came with rice. The lamb was not too fatty and was very tender - really excellent! Might not get the curry again because it is so fattening with all the coconut milk, or maybe I can just avoid eating all the coconut milk curry and only eat some of it plus the meat.

The chicken vepudu is good and interesting. I'm not sure if it comes without dairy by default or if you have to order it special with no dairy. It is a bit hot for me but if I take breaks between eating then it's not too hot. It comes with lightly fried batter, maybe lightly fried onions and other things, and the meat is tender. Would get again.

The lamb bhuna was delicious. Would order again.

The lentil soup was tasty but I would prefer more solid lentils in my lentil soup so I won't get it again. Some may like it.

I spent a month traveling around India, and one of my favorite experiences was sampling the local biryani all over the country. It was heavenly.

HZ is one of the few Indian restaurants in the Tri-State area where I taste that same level of authenticity and flavor. The Hyderabadi Goongura Veg Dum Biryani is uncompromisingly savory and tart, driven by the fermented hibiscus paste that they layer throughout. The Mahi Fry Biryani features complex layers of spices, as does the Lamb Fry Biryani--and neither rely on the animal protein to provide flavor to the rice. Rather, the protein is complementary to the spice flavor profiles already encased in the rice.

Their other dishes are no losers either, from the wonderfully zesty HZ Special Chicken Lollipops, to the hearty Kadhai Subz, to the pungent Gobi 65. But the biryani is really the quarterback of the lot, and you should not leave without trying at least one.

Finally, no more schlepping to Newark Ave in Jersey City!
Best garlic naan in NYC! The fish was so tender. I always done here when I‚Äôm in Hells Kitchen

This is a real hole in the wall find. We live in the area and are so happy to have found this place. It will be our new go to Indian spot! We had the chicken biryani, goat biryani, garlic naan and another chicken appetizer. I also had the Mango Lassi which seemed to have been house made and was probably the best one I ever had. Everything was absolutely delicious and even got approved by our South Indian friend. It‚Äôs a very small and casual restaurant. More of a take out place, but if you can still sit down and dine in. They have 3 tables for groups of 4 and some single seats by the wall. The staff is very friendly! The prices are very affordable for midtown. It was so delicious I‚Äôm already thinking about the next time we‚Äôll come back.

I order from this place often. But today my order of palak paneer had a giant piece of chicken in it!! I‚Äôm a vegetarian!!! This is unacceptable. Won‚Äôt be ordering from here again and if you care about food allergies or dietary restrictions, I suggest don‚Äôt go here

A hidden gem in Hell's Kitchen, New York, this cozy spot offers amazing flavors. We tried the Goat Fry and Goat Dum Biryani‚Äîboth dishes were absolutely delicious, packed with rich, authentic spices.

This place used to be WARKOP, an Indonesian eatery selling indomie instant noodles that closed down early last year, but I have to say this is a well worth replacement because I think I finally found the best biryanis of my life‚Ä¶ ü§Ø

Had both the Hyderabadi Dum Goat biryani and the Dum Chicken biryani, both were very delicious but the goat one is significantly more fragrant! Truly couldn‚Äôt stop eating it!!

Everyone talks about their Chicken Veppudu appetizer, which was indeed so great, but no one talks about the APOLLO FISH. Omg these were absolutely phenomenal, it‚Äôs similar to the 65 seasonings but even more refreshing.

Will come back very soon but here‚Äôs everything I tried and really liked so far:
- Gobi 65 (cauliflower)
- Apollo Fish
- Chicken Veppudu
- Malabar Shrimp Curry (on the sweeter side, perfect with naan)
- Garlic naan
- Hyderabadi Goat Dum Biryani and the Chicken Dum Biryani

Service was pretty fast, and it was packed on a Tuesday night. Love love love.

The food was absolutely wonderful and the people were super nice. The sauces were delicious and intensely spiced in a beautiful way (though the dishes I ordered were not spicy). I almost went back the following day to recapture the rapture but it didn‚Äôt work out. Oh well. Go here!
Very casual walk-down with probably the best biryani I‚Äôve ever had. Pictured is the chicken vepudu (HIGHLY recommend) appetizer and the paneer biryani.

Quintessential NYC hole-in-the wall with outstanding food. Biryani is a must. Any of them but I love the veggie one with mango. This is a place where you go for the food only, not the ambience. The pictures on the wall are low resolution Jpgs blown up into poster size. It is loud and they can only seat about 16 people. Prices are incredibly reasonable for the quality of food. EDIT! They fixed the pictures on the wall and now they have little cardamon candy seeds at the end of the meal. Staff is really delightful. We've been back at least a dozen times.

We stopped in for a quick bite at this cozy, small Indian restaurant. Due to the limited seating, we shared a table with another couple, but the warm and welcoming ambiance made it comfortable. We ordered the goat biryani, mango lassi, and chicken vepudu. The service was quick, and all the dishes were packed with flavor (especially the biryani sauce!) and absolutely delicious. We left very satisfied :)

I was told this was the best Indian restaurant in Manhattan and damn was that right! I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever had paneer tikka as creamy and perfectly spiced anywhere else, and the palak corn was a new dish I‚Äôve never tried before that I‚Ä¶

First they don‚Äôt have any hospitality, they don‚Äôt know how to talk to customer or how to host.

No good place to seat,
Taste and aroma of Hyderabadi biryani spoiled, hygiene is zero‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Rice was undercooked, place is small and stinky
Food was amazing! Super great service too.

Absolutely lived upto the hype! The server made us feel comfortable and was very kind. We ordered the chicken biryani, hyderabadi goat biryani and the Malabari shrimp curry with rice. And OMG. Each dish was just out of the world!! To top it off, the prices are actually much more affordable compared to NYC standards.  Highly recommend and definitely coming back!‚ù§Ô∏è

This Indian spot in Midtown is the real deal! Flavors are on point, spices are üî•, and the staff is friendly. The curries and biryanis are next level. If you're into legit Indian grub, this place is a must-hit in the heart of NYC! üçõüëå

The food at Hyderabadi Zaiqa is exceptional and incredibly affordable. While the location is small, the quick and efficient service more than makes up for it. They also offer a unique selection of Indian sodas worth trying. I highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to enjoy authentic and flavorful dishes!

Fabulous and amazing service. Goat biriyani was excellent and the daal tadka is the closest to homemade we‚Äôve had. Staff were so kind, efficient, and helpful even in the midst of an insane rush. Special shout out to Deepak and Saiyesh for their hospitality and accommodating our party so kindly!! Would recommend a million times over.
The best Indian food I‚Äôve had. Cool atmosphere, they don‚Äôt have a lot of seating so takeout is definitely the way to go but so delicious.
